intro: Dodecatheon pauciflorum var. monanthum, commonly known as the single-flowered glory-of-the-snow, is a herbaceous perennial native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the Primulaceae family and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows to a height of 15–30 cm and features lance-shaped leaves with a hairy texture. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland habitats. The flowers bloom in early spring, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
